title: [BUG] MacBookPro Big Sur 11.1 Apple Silicon M1
body:
**Describe the bug**
installed redis from homebrew 

56768:C 06 Jan 2021 11:22:29.492 # oO0OoO0OoO0Oo Redis is starting oO0OoO0OoO0Oo
56768:C 06 Jan 2021 11:22:29.492 # Redis version=6.0.9, bits=64, commit=00000000, modified=0, pid=56768, just started
56768:C 06 Jan 2021 11:22:29.492 # Configuration loaded
56768:M 06 Jan 2021 11:22:29.494 * Increased maximum number of open files to 10032 (it was originally set to 256).


=== REDIS BUG REPORT START: Cut & paste starting from here ===
56768:M 06 Jan 2021 11:22:29.498 # Redis 6.0.9 crashed by signal: 11, si_code: 2
56768:M 06 Jan 2021 11:22:29.498 # Crashed running the instruction at: 0x7fff20374430
56768:M 06 Jan 2021 11:22:29.498 # Accessing address: 0x309bd3000

56768:M 06 Jan 2021 11:22:29.498 # Failed assertion: <no assertion failed> (<no file>:0)

comments_data.body:
Try running it with `sudo`. e.g.

`sudo redis-server --daemonize yes`

@superchen180 thanks for reporting.
this is a duplicate of #8062
resolved by #8088 and #8150
Please check Redis 6.2-RC1, it should fix this problem.
i guess we'll soon make another release of 6.0 that'll solve it there too.
